title: White Bean Soup with Greens & Turkey
ingredients: 1 bunch sturdy greens (kale, broccoli rabe, mustard greens, or collard greens)
2 (15oz) cans white beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup chopped fresh soft herbs (parsley, mint, dill, basil, tarragon, chives, or combo)
instructions: Heat large pot over med-high heat. Add oil and heat until it thins out, about 30 sec.
Add onion, carrot. Saute until very soft and brown at edges (7-10 mins).
Rinse greens and pull leaves off stems. Tear or chop into bite-size pieces, set aside.
When onion is golden, add tomato paste, 3/4 tsp cumin and 1/8 tsp red pepper. Saute until paste darkens, about 1 min.
Add turkey, garlic, ginger, 1 tsp salt, and saute, breaking up meat, until turkey is browned in spots (4-7 mins).
Add stock and beans, bring to simmer. Let simmer until soup is thick (15-25 mins).
For thicker broth, puree 2 cups of soup and return to pot.
Add greens and simmer until soft (5-10 mins).
Stir herbs and lemon juice, add more salt, cumin, lemon as desired.
